topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Managing Your Cloud with the HCG Dashboard

body.p: The HCG Dashboard UI is a cloud management tool that allows users to define, deploy, manage, and monitor a HP Helion OpenStack cloud. The tool helps you provide and validate the cloud definitions required to deploy your cloud and guide you through the deployment.
body.section:
After you enter all necessary information for your cloud, you will be redirected to a page where you can see description and current status of your cloud. The page appears similar to the following:
Click the Deploy Cloud dashboard.
Click Run to start deploying the cloud.
The deployment consists of four phases: Provision, Generate, Netinit and Deploy. As the phases progress, you will see the name of your cloud and current status at the top of the page and the marker on the wizard will move to the process as it completes.
Note: If you receive an error during the Deploy phase, rerun Deploy.
The process runs asynchronously in background. So while a process is running, if you close your session or browser, you can still return to the same page again to check status of your process. Also, when your process is running, you can look at the current log content by clicking on the Logs tab and selecting a log file pertaining to that process as seen below:
Once the process completes, you will be notified whether it passed or failed as seen below:
To execute a particular process, you can click on a step and click Run. Note: To execute a process, all previous processes must be completed.
